etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
etymology.interpretation: A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.

examples.chinese: 他张开口，说了几句(他張開口，說了幾句)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
examples.english: He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.

examples.chinese: 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
examples.pinyin: Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
examples.english: A family of three lives in this small town.

examples.chinese: 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
examples.english: She took a bite of the apple.
